<p> Fog simulates atmospheric effects by blending distant objects with fog color. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#Fog" target="_blank">Fog</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/enveffects.html" target="_blank">24 Environmental effects component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/enveffects.html#Concepts" target="_blank">24.2 Concepts</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/enveffects.html#X3DFogObject" target="_blank">24.3.2 X3DFogObject</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/enveffects.html#Fog" target="_blank">24.4.2 Fog</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter23Fog" target="_blank">Chapter 23 Fog</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter11LightingEnvironmentalEffects" target="_blank">Chapter 11 Lighting Environmental Effects</a> </li> </ul>
